title: 112_s3575
content: The Act may be cited as the "LGBT Elder Americans Act of 2012". Definitions are provided in the Act. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include status as an LGBT individual. The term 'LGBT' is defined as a lesbian, gay, bisexual, or transgender individual. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include LGBT individuals as minorities. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include LGBT individuals as minorities. Section 3 focuses on the Administration on Aging. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include LGBT individuals as minorities, with a focus on addressing their needs within the Administration on Aging. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include LGBT individuals as minorities and establish the National Resource Center on Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Aging to address their unique challenges and provide necessary services. The National Resource Center on Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Aging aims to educate aging services organizations and LGBT organizations about the special needs of LGBT older adults, while also providing educational resources to LGBT older adults and their caregivers. Entities seeking funds must demonstrate expertise in working with LGBT individuals and have experience in addressing issues affecting this community. Entities seeking funds under this subsection must have experience in providing training and technical assistance on a national basis or have a formal relationship with an organization that has that experience. They must also meet additional criteria set by the Assistant Secretary. To be eligible for funds, an entity must submit an application containing required information. The Assistant Secretary will provide necessary resources to the Center annually to effectively carry out its functions, with a minimum amount equivalent to that provided to the National Resource Center on Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Aging in fiscal year 2012. The Assistant Secretary will develop operating standards and reporting requirements for the Center on Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Aging. Section 207 of the Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include reporting on the effectiveness of activities in assisting LGBT individuals. The Assistant Secretary will ensure that no individual is required to disclose their sexual orientation or gender identity to participate in activities or receive services under the Act. Agencies providing services must not disclose this information in a way that identifies individuals. Protocols will be developed for successful data implementation by State and area agencies on aging. The Assistant Secretary will determine the timing for data collection requirements related to LGBT individuals, ensuring implementation by agencies on aging. The requirements must be met within 1 year of the enactment of the LGBT Elder Americans Act of 2012. SEC. 4 amends the Older Americans Act to include organizations serving LGBT individuals. SEC. 5 focuses on activities for health, independence, and longevity. Section 411(a)(11) of the Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to conduct activities promoting quality services for individuals with social needs, including addressing health disparities, long-term care, culturally responsive services, and more. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to address gaps in assistance and issues important to older individuals with social needs. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to collect and analyze data on discrimination against LGBT older individuals in long term care settings based on sexual orientation or gender identity.
